alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Deaf Smith; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 28 at 2:39AM CST until February 28 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHWESTERN TO SOUTH-CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHWEST TO SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect Wednesday afternoon. * Affected Area...In Texas...Oldham...Potter...Deaf Smith... Randall...Armstrong and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...For today, Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For tomorrow, Southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidity...For today, low as 10 percent. For tomorrow, as low as 12 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...For today, 3 to 6. For tomorrow, 1 to 3. * Timing...10 AM through 8 PM CST Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
